I play a bit of first person titles, these games are typically fast paced and require a nice steady framerate/connection.  I played with my settings maxed out and came across some issues with choppiness and some lag.  The software included with ROG Zephyrus is required reading. The Asus ROG Zephyrus is an absolute beast of a laptop. From it having a GeForce RTX 4090 graphics card to the powerful intel core 9 processor. It boasts a beautiful 16 inch oled display and it never ceases to amaze me.

Appearance
The latest Asus laptop does not disappoint. The look and feel of the laptop are simply amazing, it is sleek and beautiful. The most interesting addition being that of the back light. The laptop also comes equipped with a wide array of features to enhance the overall look. The most interesting thing of the bunch, being the ability to change the lighting color options on the laptop.

Gaming
My experience with the Asus ROG so far has primarily been with gaming and boy oh boy it doesn’t disappoint. I first started off playing Sons of the Forest and noticed that the laptop performed quite well but wasn’t able to handle the game properly unless it was plugged in. The graphics were simply amazing for such a demanding game, while having it on the highest graphics settings. I didn’t have to lower the graphics at all, and it still ran perfectly fine.
Next, I played FF14 and it ran smoothly. FF14 like Sons of the forest is a relatively demanding game that can push one’s hardware to the absolute limits if not properly equipped. The Asus ROG handled the game extremely well and it was an absolute treat to hear the soundtracks through a laptop that has such a high-quality sounds system.
Following that, I played some classic GameCube games on the laptop. I started off with Kirby air ride and quickly determined that I could push the graphics to the upper end for the emulator and get a solid performance. It ran fine with no issues whatsoever.

Responsiveness
A major plus for the Asus laptop is its responsiveness. Through using it, I was able to transition from one game to another or even to YouTube with no time at all. If I were to compare it to anything, it would be with that of the Xbox series X and how you can almost seemingly switch between games with little to know down time.

Battery
The battery life for the Asus rogue is similar to that of competitors. It’s not horrible, but not phenomenal, which is in line with most gaming laptops. The only time the battery life drains quickly is when playing super demanding games, such as GTA5. On the other hand, I did notice that when playing games such as Star Dew Valley, which is on the lower end, the battery held up a great deal longer.
Something I noticed with this laptop is that the fan isn’t as loud as one would expect from a gaming laptop.

Audio
I would say that the highlight of the Asus laptop to me is 100% the audio quality. The most accurate comparison I can give to it would be the equivalent of sitting in a movie theatre. You can hear the robust audio from all angles to such a degree that it most definitely increases one’s immersion when gaming or even when watching videos from YouTube. The placement of the speakers is also a plus due to them being in noninvasive parts of the laptop.

Emersion
The way the laptop is set up, enables a great deal of emersion. By that, I’m referring to the display on top of the audio. As I said previously, it feels as if I am in a high-class movie theatre. The Asus laptop draws one in with its emersion, which is highly impressive for a laptop of its size.

Cons
The absolute only cons I have for this laptop is that it does mark up easily on the outside due to the material. Basically, I find myself having to wipe down my laptop quite often with a cloth in order to get rid of the fingerprint marks.
The other con I have is the charging cord. When plugging it in the laptop, I find myself having to try to re-plug it in the “correct way” quite often due to how it is supposed to plug into the laptop. It’s not your standard laptop/desktop cord. A minor problem, but one that could be easily remedied in the end by having small labels that outline which way it should go in.

Conclusion
The Asus Rog Zephyrus is a staple for gaming laptops. It provides solid gaming performance, a massive array of customizability options, unparalleled sound, and a beautiful display. If I were to compare it to any of the gaming laptops I owned previously, it would be Alienware. I do, however, prefer this one due to the reasons mentioned throughout the review.

No use burying the lede on this one...this is absolutely, without a doubt, the best laptop I have ever used.

Let's talk performance: In Adobe Audition, I had 24 concurrent audio files open and playing in a multitrack session with not a single hiccup or stutter. Nothing I threw at this device in Premiere slowed it down - multiple files, graphics, and animations, and full speed ahead with everything. In Media Encoder, I was able to render a 3 minute 1080p video in 5 seconds. FIVE SECONDS! A 60 minute video rendered out in 6 and a half minutes. If you're considering this device as a media production laptop, you absolutely will be happy.

Now for gaming? I am blown away. I've only had this laptop for a few days, but I have already played Starfield, No Man's Sky, Skyrim: Anniversary Edition, Mass Effect: Legendary Edition, and Mass Effect: Andromeda - all on their highest possible settings without a single stutter. Seeing some of these games at 240Hz for the first time was literally breath-taking.

Now for the hardware - starting with that 240Hz screen...it's gorgeous. Being OLED as well, the color contrast is fantastic, the response time is great, the bezels are small, 16" is more than enough to have a great gaming experience without needing to hook up a monitor (which you can easily do, by the way, since this laptop actually has an HDMI port - which are becoming an endangered species). The speakers are also fantastic - upward firing and quite large, they produce a relatively full range of sound. They are laptop speakers though, so you will get a better experience with headphones (but the difference is not as stark as it is on most laptops). The keyboard is great as well; keys are well spaced, the extra four "M" keys above the keyboard are very useful, and each key is subtly cupped, making for a great typing experience. The trackpad is fine, but it actually might be *too* big; it's pretty easy to accidentally rest your palms on the top corners while playing a game - but it performs well, and the extra real estate is great for when you're getting some work done. The build quality is also top-notch - fully metal, no bending or creaking, ample fan ports for keeping things cool, and a neat little quirk with the "slash" lighting on the lid.

One other thing about this physical hardware that I am very grateful for is that it looks like a normal laptop. This is actually the first "gaming" laptop I've ever used, mostly because all of the other computers in this category look like they were designed for middle school children with all the flashing lights and gaudy design choices. Whereas with this Zephyrus, you could take this to work or the coffee shop and you would blend right in.

One last standout feature to me is the included ASUS Software called "Armoury Crate." It is super intuitive, and allows great control of features like CPU & GPU performance, lighting, fan speed, and other configurations. As someone who is using a "gaming" laptop for the first time, this software is easy to use and understand, and I am grateful.

...Nothing is perfect though, right? There is one downside to this laptop: the fan. It's loud. Very loud. Which isn't a *bad* thing...it's actually a very necessary thing to allow the incredible performance that this laptop can put out...but it is something to be aware of. With this CPU and the RTX 4090 inside, things need to stay cool. I generally have headphones on when I'm working or playing so I don't really notice it, but it is something to be aware of.

If you can't tell - I love this laptop. I know the cost is high, but it is absolutely, 100% worth it if you care about top quality performance. You will not be disappointed.
